groups.description: Less weight to VA examination than to non-VA medical and lay evidence
Less weight to VA examination than to non-VA mental health professional (Prong 3)
Less weight to VA examination than to non-VA physician (Prong 3)

sentences.text: Report of the May 2014 VA examination reflects, in pertinent part, a diagnosis of chronic depressive disorder.

rhetClass.text: Report of the May 2014 VA examination reflects, in pertinent part, a diagnosis of chronic depressive disorder.

sentences.text: The examiner indicated the Veteran does not have a diagnosis of PTSD.

rhetClass.text: The examiner indicated the Veteran does not have a diagnosis of PTSD.

sentences.text: Specifically, the examiner noted the Veteran did not meet criterion C, D, F-H.

rhetClass.text: Specifically, the examiner noted the Veteran did not meet criterion C, D, F-H.

sentences.text: The examiner noted prior PTSD screening tests of record which were negative for PTSD.

rhetClass.text: The examiner noted prior PTSD screening tests of record which were negative for PTSD.

sentences.text: Rather, the Veteran was diagnosed with depression, not otherwise specified, at that time.

rhetClass.text: Rather, the Veteran was diagnosed with depression, not otherwise specified, at that time.

sentences.text: In addressing the depressive disorder, the examiner indicated that it is less likely than not related to service given onset was so far removed from service to be reasonably related.

rhetClass.text: In addressing the depressive disorder, the examiner indicated that it is less likely than not related to service given onset was so far removed from service to be reasonably related.

sentences.text: Here, the Board finds that service connection is warranted for the psychiatric disability that is currently afflicting the Veteran.

rhetClass.text: Here, the Board finds that service connection is warranted for the psychiatric disability that is currently afflicting the Veteran.

polarity.text: Here, the Board finds that service connection is warranted for the psychiatric disability that is currently afflicting the Veteran.

ruleID.text: Here, the Board finds that service connection is warranted for the psychiatric disability that is currently afflicting the Veteran.

sentences.text: To that extent, the Board notes that any inconsistency regarding the diagnoses of a specific psychiatric disorder is harmless for rating purposes because a grant of service connection for an acquired psychiatric disorder incorporates all such psychiatric symptomatology reported by the Veteran.

rhetClass.text: To that extent, the Board notes that any inconsistency regarding the diagnoses of a specific psychiatric disorder is harmless for rating purposes because a grant of service connection for an acquired psychiatric disorder incorporates all such psychiatric symptomatology reported by the Veteran.

sentences.text: The evidence clearly shows the Veteran has an acquired psychiatric disorder.

rhetClass.text: The evidence clearly shows the Veteran has an acquired psychiatric disorder.

sentences.text: At a minimum, he has a diagnosis of chronic depressive disorder.

rhetClass.text: At a minimum, he has a diagnosis of chronic depressive disorder.

sentences.text: Concerning an in-service event, illness, or injury, the Veteran has consistently reported psychiatric symptoms stemming from one or more traumatic events in service.

rhetClass.text: Concerning an in-service event, illness, or injury, the Veteran has consistently reported psychiatric symptoms stemming from one or more traumatic events in service.

sentences.text: Of note, the Veteran's military decorations include the CIB.

rhetClass.text: Of note, the Veteran's military decorations include the CIB.

sentences.text: Inasmuch as at least one reported event is consistent with his duties as an Infantryman, the Board finds that the event is consistent with the places and circumstances of his service.

rhetClass.text: Inasmuch as at least one reported event is consistent with his duties as an Infantryman, the Board finds that the event is consistent with the places and circumstances of his service.

polarity.text: Inasmuch as at least one reported event is consistent with his duties as an Infantryman, the Board finds that the event is consistent with the places and circumstances of his service.

ruleID.text: Inasmuch as at least one reported event is consistent with his duties as an Infantryman, the Board finds that the event is consistent with the places and circumstances of his service.

sentences.text: Finally, the Veteran's private physician, D.V., provided an opinion dated in September 2017.

rhetClass.text: Finally, the Veteran's private physician, D.V., provided an opinion dated in September 2017.

sentences.text: D@!V.

rhetClass.text: D@!V.

sentences.text: stated that the Veteran's PTSD "has led to elevated catecholamine and cortisol levels which have caused his insomnia, anxiety, and hypertension as well as weight gain, which are the contributing factors to his obstructive sleep apnea."

rhetClass.text: stated that the Veteran's PTSD "has led to elevated catecholamine and cortisol levels which have caused his insomnia, anxiety, and hypertension as well as weight gain, which are the contributing factors to his obstructive sleep apnea."

sentences.text: D@!V.

rhetClass.text: D@!V.

sentences.text: stated that there are multiple scholarly journals that support the connection between PTSD and sleep apnea and hypertension.

rhetClass.text: stated that there are multiple scholarly journals that support the connection between PTSD and sleep apnea and hypertension.

sentences.text: Therefore, the third element of secondary service connection is met.

rhetClass.text: Therefore, the third element of secondary service connection is met.

polarity.text: Therefore, the third element of secondary service connection is met.

ruleID.text: Therefore, the third element of secondary service connection is met.

sentences.text: The Board notes that the Veteran was afforded a VA examination in February 2013.

rhetClass.text: The Board notes that the Veteran was afforded a VA examination in February 2013.

sentences.text: The examiner opined that the Veteran's weight and sleep apnea can contribute to the development of hypertension.

rhetClass.text: The examiner opined that the Veteran's weight and sleep apnea can contribute to the development of hypertension.

sentences.text: The examiner stated that there is currently no recognized causal relationship between the development of hypertension and PTSD.

rhetClass.text: The examiner stated that there is currently no recognized causal relationship between the development of hypertension and PTSD.

sentences.text: The examiner further stated that to say the Veteran's PTSD caused his hypertension would be mere speculation while disregarding his comorbid conditions.

rhetClass.text: The examiner further stated that to say the Veteran's PTSD caused his hypertension would be mere speculation while disregarding his comorbid conditions.

sentences.text: The Board finds the September 2017 opinion of D.V.

rhetClass.text: The Board finds the September 2017 opinion of D.V.

sentences.text: to be more persuasive and probative than the VA examination.

rhetClass.text: to be more persuasive and probative than the VA examination.

sentences.text: D@!V.

rhetClass.text: D@!V.

sentences.text: cited to research supporting a connection between PTSD and sleep apnea and hypertension.

rhetClass.text: cited to research supporting a connection between PTSD and sleep apnea and hypertension.

sentences.text: D@!V.

rhetClass.text: D@!V.

sentences.text: also addressed the role of the Veteran's comorbid conditions, as well as his elevated catecholamine and cortisol levels, which the VA examiner did not address.

rhetClass.text: also addressed the role of the Veteran's comorbid conditions, as well as his elevated catecholamine and cortisol levels, which the VA examiner did not address.

sentences.text: Therefore, the Board affords more probative weight to the 2017 opinion of D.V.

rhetClass.text: Therefore, the Board affords more probative weight to the 2017 opinion of D.V.

sentences.text: and the Veteran is entitled to service connection for sleep apnea and hypertension.

rhetClass.text: and the Veteran is entitled to service connection for sleep apnea and hypertension.

sentences.text: Finally, the evidence of record persuasively suggests a nexus between the Veterans' acquired psychiatric disorder and military service.

rhetClass.text: Finally, the evidence of record persuasively suggests a nexus between the Veterans' acquired psychiatric disorder and military service.

polarity.text: Finally, the evidence of record persuasively suggests a nexus between the Veterans' acquired psychiatric disorder and military service.

ruleID.text: Finally, the evidence of record persuasively suggests a nexus between the Veterans' acquired psychiatric disorder and military service.

sentences.text: Specifically, the May 2013 physician's statement opined, in pertinent part, that the Veteran's chronic depression is caused by or a result of his combat exposure in Vietnam.

rhetClass.text: Specifically, the May 2013 physician's statement opined, in pertinent part, that the Veteran's chronic depression is caused by or a result of his combat exposure in Vietnam.

sentences.text: Moreover, statements by Dr. C.C.

rhetClass.text: Moreover, statements by Dr. C.C.

sentences.text: reflect a history of psychiatric symptoms since service.

rhetClass.text: reflect a history of psychiatric symptoms since service.

sentences.text: This information is further corroborated by the statements from the Veteran and his spouse who indicated the Veteran was "never [] the same" after he returned from service.

rhetClass.text: This information is further corroborated by the statements from the Veteran and his spouse who indicated the Veteran was "never [] the same" after he returned from service.

sentences.text: She identified symptoms that are readily attributable to psychiatric disorders, including sleep disturbance and erratic mood.

rhetClass.text: She identified symptoms that are readily attributable to psychiatric disorders, including sleep disturbance and erratic mood.

sentences.text: The Board acknowledges the negative nexus opinion provided in the May 2014 VA examination report.

rhetClass.text: The Board acknowledges the negative nexus opinion provided in the May 2014 VA examination report.

sentences.text: The Board notes, however, that the examiner's opinion was primarily focused on the lack of symptomatology until several decades after service.

rhetClass.text: The Board notes, however, that the examiner's opinion was primarily focused on the lack of symptomatology until several decades after service.

sentences.text: This is inconsistent with the remainder of the evidence of record.

rhetClass.text: This is inconsistent with the remainder of the evidence of record.

sentences.text: In particular, several lay statements of record reflect the Veteran experienced psychiatric symptoms since service.

rhetClass.text: In particular, several lay statements of record reflect the Veteran experienced psychiatric symptoms since service.

sentences.text: Moreover, the Veteran explained that his lack of knowledge about psychiatric disorders is what prevented them from seeking appropriate treatment earlier.

rhetClass.text: Moreover, the Veteran explained that his lack of knowledge about psychiatric disorders is what prevented them from seeking appropriate treatment earlier.

sentences.text: It is not clear whether or to what extent this information would change the examiner's opinion, but given the examiner did not consider it, the Board accords the May 2014 VA examination less probative weight.

rhetClass.text: It is not clear whether or to what extent this information would change the examiner's opinion, but given the examiner did not consider it, the Board accords the May 2014 VA examination less probative weight.

sentences.text: Based on the above, the Board finds that the medical evidence is, at the very least, in equipoise as to whether the Veteran's acquired psychiatric disorder was caused by or a result of his active military service.

rhetClass.text: Based on the above, the Board finds that the medical evidence is, at the very least, in equipoise as to whether the Veteran's acquired psychiatric disorder was caused by or a result of his active military service.

polarity.text: Based on the above, the Board finds that the medical evidence is, at the very least, in equipoise as to whether the Veteran's acquired psychiatric disorder was caused by or a result of his active military service.

ruleID.text: Based on the above, the Board finds that the medical evidence is, at the very least, in equipoise as to whether the Veteran's acquired psychiatric disorder was caused by or a result of his active military service.

sentences.text: Therefore, resolving reasonable doubt in the Veteran's favor, service connection for an acquired psychiatric disorder is warranted.

rhetClass.text: Therefore, resolving reasonable doubt in the Veteran's favor, service connection for an acquired psychiatric disorder is warranted.

polarity.text: Therefore, resolving reasonable doubt in the Veteran's favor, service connection for an acquired psychiatric disorder is warranted.

ruleID.text: Therefore, resolving reasonable doubt in the Veteran's favor, service connection for an acquired psychiatric disorder is warranted.

sentences.text: The evidence received by the Veteran consists of an assessment and diagnosis from a licensed mental health counselor.

rhetClass.text: The evidence received by the Veteran consists of an assessment and diagnosis from a licensed mental health counselor.

sentences.text: The assessment notes that the Veteran reported mental health issues since his return from serving in Vietnam.

rhetClass.text: The assessment notes that the Veteran reported mental health issues since his return from serving in Vietnam.

sentences.text: The evaluation states a detailed assessment was administered with a determination that the Veteran's PTSD is related to his history of military trauma.

rhetClass.text: The evaluation states a detailed assessment was administered with a determination that the Veteran's PTSD is related to his history of military trauma.

sentences.text: The Veteran submitted an assessment and evaluation from a mental health counselor dated March 2010.

rhetClass.text: The Veteran submitted an assessment and evaluation from a mental health counselor dated March 2010.

sentences.text: The examiner determined a diagnosis of PTSD based on the DSM-IV criteria and opined the diagnosis was related to military experiences.

rhetClass.text: The examiner determined a diagnosis of PTSD based on the DSM-IV criteria and opined the diagnosis was related to military experiences.

sentences.text: In May 2014, the Veteran underwent a VA examination.

rhetClass.text: In May 2014, the Veteran underwent a VA examination.

sentences.text: The VA examiner also noted the Veteran gave information that was inconsistent with his medical records and stated that there was no "concrete evidence" to support the alleged stressors.

rhetClass.text: The VA examiner also noted the Veteran gave information that was inconsistent with his medical records and stated that there was no "concrete evidence" to support the alleged stressors.

sentences.text: Based on these reasons, the VA examiner stated that a diagnosis of PTSD was not warranted.

rhetClass.text: Based on these reasons, the VA examiner stated that a diagnosis of PTSD was not warranted.

sentences.text: After reviewing all the evidence of record, the Board finds the March 2010 assessment more probative than the VA examination.

rhetClass.text: After reviewing all the evidence of record, the Board finds the March 2010 assessment more probative than the VA examination.

sentences.text: The VA examiner did not give appropriate weight to the Veteran's lay statements regarding his in-service stressor.

rhetClass.text: The VA examiner did not give appropriate weight to the Veteran's lay statements regarding his in-service stressor.

sentences.text: Additionally, the VA examiner did not evaluate or consider the assessment and opinion of the private mental health professional, which found the Veteran's PTSD related to his military experiences.

rhetClass.text: Additionally, the VA examiner did not evaluate or consider the assessment and opinion of the private mental health professional, which found the Veteran's PTSD related to his military experiences.

sentences.text: Therefore, after resolving all reasonable doubt in favor of the Veteran, the Board finds service connection for PTSD is warranted.

rhetClass.text: Therefore, after resolving all reasonable doubt in favor of the Veteran, the Board finds service connection for PTSD is warranted.

polarity.text: Therefore, after resolving all reasonable doubt in favor of the Veteran, the Board finds service connection for PTSD is warranted.

ruleID.text: Therefore, after resolving all reasonable doubt in favor of the Veteran, the Board finds service connection for PTSD is warranted.

sentences.text: The Veteran submitted an assessment and evaluation from a mental health counselor dated March 2010.

rhetClass.text: The Veteran submitted an assessment and evaluation from a mental health counselor dated March 2010.

sentences.text: The examiner determined a diagnosis of PTSD based on the DSM-IV criteria and opined the diagnosis was related to military experiences.

rhetClass.text: The examiner determined a diagnosis of PTSD based on the DSM-IV criteria and opined the diagnosis was related to military experiences.

sentences.text: In May 2014, the Veteran underwent a VA examination.

rhetClass.text: In May 2014, the Veteran underwent a VA examination.

sentences.text: The VA examiner stated that the record did not contain a diagnosis of PTSD related to military experiences, stating that a PTSD diagnosis from February 2013 appeared to be related to the death of the Veteran's son.

rhetClass.text: The VA examiner stated that the record did not contain a diagnosis of PTSD related to military experiences, stating that a PTSD diagnosis from February 2013 appeared to be related to the death of the Veteran's son.

sentences.text: The VA examiner also noted the Veteran gave information that was inconsistent with his medical records and stated that there was no "concrete evidence" to support the alleged stressors.

rhetClass.text: The VA examiner also noted the Veteran gave information that was inconsistent with his medical records and stated that there was no "concrete evidence" to support the alleged stressors.

sentences.text: Based on these reasons, the VA examiner stated that a diagnosis of PTSD was not warranted.

rhetClass.text: Based on these reasons, the VA examiner stated that a diagnosis of PTSD was not warranted.

sentences.text: See C&P Exam May 2014.

rhetClass.text: See C&P Exam May 2014.

sentences.text: The Board finds the evidence is in equipoise as to whether or not there is a current diagnosis of PTSD.

rhetClass.text: The Board finds the evidence is in equipoise as to whether or not there is a current diagnosis of PTSD.

polarity.text: The Board finds the evidence is in equipoise as to whether or not there is a current diagnosis of PTSD.

ruleID.text: The Board finds the evidence is in equipoise as to whether or not there is a current diagnosis of PTSD.

sentences.text: Therefore, giving the Veteran the benefit of the doubt, the Board finds a current diagnosis of PTSD.

rhetClass.text: Therefore, giving the Veteran the benefit of the doubt, the Board finds a current diagnosis of PTSD.

polarity.text: Therefore, giving the Veteran the benefit of the doubt, the Board finds a current diagnosis of PTSD.

ruleID.text: Therefore, giving the Veteran the benefit of the doubt, the Board finds a current diagnosis of PTSD.

sentences.text: The Veteran reported an alleged in-service stressor involving a mortar attack while stationed at Chu Lai in March 1968.

rhetClass.text: The Veteran reported an alleged in-service stressor involving a mortar attack while stationed at Chu Lai in March 1968.

sentences.text: At the May 2014 VA examination , the VA examiner noted that the Veteran's alleged stressor is adequate to support a diagnosis of PTSD and related to the Veteran's fear of hostile military or terrorist activity.

rhetClass.text: At the May 2014 VA examination , the VA examiner noted that the Veteran's alleged stressor is adequate to support a diagnosis of PTSD and related to the Veteran's fear of hostile military or terrorist activity.

sentences.text: Without clear and convincing evidence to the contrary, a lay testimony, alone, may be sufficient to establish the occurrence an in-service stressor related to fear of hostile military activity.

rhetClass.text: Without clear and convincing evidence to the contrary, a lay testimony, alone, may be sufficient to establish the occurrence an in-service stressor related to fear of hostile military activity.

sentences.text: The record establishes that members of the Veteran's unit in Vietnam were temporarily assigned to Chu Lai in support of military combat.

rhetClass.text: The record establishes that members of the Veteran's unit in Vietnam were temporarily assigned to Chu Lai in support of military combat.

sentences.text: See Third Party Correspondence August 1998.

rhetClass.text: See Third Party Correspondence August 1998.

sentences.text: However, in June 2010, it was determined that there was insufficient information to verify the Veteran's alleged in-service stressor.

rhetClass.text: However, in June 2010, it was determined that there was insufficient information to verify the Veteran's alleged in-service stressor.

sentences.text: Nonetheless, the Veteran's lay statements are sufficient to establish his in-service stressor as the record does not contain any clear and convincing evidence to the contrary.

rhetClass.text: Nonetheless, the Veteran's lay statements are sufficient to establish his in-service stressor as the record does not contain any clear and convincing evidence to the contrary.

sentences.text: After reviewing all the evidence of record, the Board finds the March 2010 assessment more probative than the VA examination.

rhetClass.text: After reviewing all the evidence of record, the Board finds the March 2010 assessment more probative than the VA examination.

sentences.text: The VA examiner did not give appropriate weight to the Veteran's lay statements regarding his in-service stressor.

rhetClass.text: The VA examiner did not give appropriate weight to the Veteran's lay statements regarding his in-service stressor.

sentences.text: Additionally, the VA examiner did not evaluate or consider the assessment and opinion of the private mental health professional, which found the Veteran's PTSD related to his military experiences.

rhetClass.text: Additionally, the VA examiner did not evaluate or consider the assessment and opinion of the private mental health professional, which found the Veteran's PTSD related to his military experiences.

sentences.text: Therefore, after resolving all reasonable doubt in favor of the Veteran, the Board finds service connection for PTSD is warranted.

rhetClass.text: Therefore, after resolving all reasonable doubt in favor of the Veteran, the Board finds service connection for PTSD is warranted.

polarity.text: Therefore, after resolving all reasonable doubt in favor of the Veteran, the Board finds service connection for PTSD is warranted.

ruleID.text: Therefore, after resolving all reasonable doubt in favor of the Veteran, the Board finds service connection for PTSD is warranted.

sentences.text: See 38 U.S.C.  5107; 38 C.F.R.  3.102; Gilbert v. Derwinski, 1 Vet. App. 49 (1990).

rhetClass.text: See 38 U.S.C.  5107; 38 C.F.R.  3.102; Gilbert v. Derwinski, 1 Vet. App. 49 (1990).

sentences.text: Service connection may also be warranted for a disability that is proximately due to or the result of a service-connected disability.

rhetClass.text: Service connection may also be warranted for a disability that is proximately due to or the result of a service-connected disability.

sentences.text: Secondary service connection requires (1) evidence of a current disability; (2) evidence of a service-connected disability; and (3) evidence establishing a connection between the service-connected disability and the current disability.

rhetClass.text: Secondary service connection requires (1) evidence of a current disability; (2) evidence of a service-connected disability; and (3) evidence establishing a connection between the service-connected disability and the current disability.

sentences.text: Wallin v. West, 11 Vet. App. 509, 512 (1998).

rhetClass.text: Wallin v. West, 11 Vet. App. 509, 512 (1998).

sentences.text: Here, treatment records dated in May 2009 reflect diagnoses of sleep apnea and hypertension, thus satisfying the first element of secondary service connection.

rhetClass.text: Here, treatment records dated in May 2009 reflect diagnoses of sleep apnea and hypertension, thus satisfying the first element of secondary service connection.

sentences.text: The Veteran is service connected for PTSD.

rhetClass.text: The Veteran is service connected for PTSD.

polarity.text: The Veteran is service connected for PTSD.

ruleID.text: The Veteran is service connected for PTSD.

sentences.text: Therefore, the second element of secondary service connection is satisfied.

rhetClass.text: Therefore, the second element of secondary service connection is satisfied.

polarity.text: Therefore, the second element of secondary service connection is satisfied.

ruleID.text: Therefore, the second element of secondary service connection is satisfied.
